txt.en: 'Oh, this ale's fair, but it can't compare to the dwarf-stouts made with barley from the Blue Mountains.'
'Ha! The Men of Bree call these hobbit-mounds hills. The majesty of the Blue Mountains would steal their breath away.'
'By Durin's beard, there are dark times afoot, you mark my words.'
'We just delivered a load of ore for the iron-mongers.'
'My cousin told me this was the place to quench your thirst after travelling the dry and dusty East Road.'
